thread.title: From the EU Referendum to the Great North Run: 10 key dates for your diary this summer
thread.title_full: From the EU Referendum to the Great North Run: 10 key dates for your diary this summer

author: nechronicle
title: From the EU Referendum to the Great North Run: 10 key dates for your diary this summer
text:
From the EU Referendum to the Great North Run: 10 key dates for your diary this summer 18:30, 20 Jun 2016 By Jasmine Watkiss To mark the official start of the summer season, we've run down the key events happening in the North East before September 21 Shares Comments Get daily news by email Ruth Davidson leader of Scottish Conservatives, Kezia Dugdale leader of Scottish Labour and Scottish First Minister, Nicola Sturgeon pose with supporting MSP's as they gather outside the Scottish Parliament with vote remain EU banners 
Despite the grey and dreary weather outside our windows, today - June 20 - is in fact the first day of summer. 
But don’t let the great British weather put you off; the North East is brimming with an abundance of diverse and exciting events for all the family this summer. 
From music festivals to sporting events, and the imminent EU referendum , there is something for everyone to get involved in. 
We’ve selected these 10 key dates for your diary this summer. June 23 - EU referendum 
It’s been impossible to avoid the EU referendum debate during recent months, with televised political discussions, countless news bulletins, and the red and blue of the ‘Vote Leave’ and ‘Remain’ posters stuck in windows of residences across the North East. 
But the wait is almost over; this Thursday, the UK will vote either to remain in or leave the European Union. 
With the referendum splitting the Tory party down the middle, and latest opinion poll results increasingly indicating Brexit, we are living in uncertain times. Your vote counts - so remember to get to your polling station. 
Thousands watch bands at the Mouth of the Tyne festival, Tynemouth July 7 - Mouth of the Tyne Festival 
The Mouth of the Tyne Festival is back in North Tyneside next month, featuring live music, world-renowned street performers, dance and arts activities. 
The colourful festival will take place in Tynemouth and Whitley Bay between Thursday, July 7 to Sunday, July 10. Headlining the festival are Brit award-winning Will Young, Grammy-nominated James Bay, and the pop music icon Lulu, alongside many other impressive acts. 
Festival-goers can also enjoy international street entertainment with acts from France, Spain, Australia and Canada, as well as a showcase for local performers. 
With activities for under-5s at Tynemouth Station, there is something for the whole family. Video loading Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video July 9 - Durham Miners’ Gala 
The 132nd Durham Miners’ Gala will take place on Saturday, July 9 this year. The gala, Britain’s biggest and most historic trade union celebration, will welcome more than 150,000 people from all over the UK to Durham City , in a celebration of heritage, solidarity and community. 
The day begins at 8am in the city centre Market Place, with an impressive parade of bands and banners moving the festivities to Durham’s picturesque Racecourse at around 8.30am. Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn is set to make an appearance during the speeches. 
Vintage Car Rally will take place at Woodhorn Museum July 10 - Woodhorn’s Vintage Car Rally 
Have a majestic day out at Woodhorn’s Vintage Car Rally at Woodhorn Museum, Northumberland on Sunday, July 10. An array of more than 50 classic cars will be provided by the North of England Classic and Pre-War Automobiles. 
Enjoy viewing the cars, taking a photo with them and chatting to the owners. The rally opens to the public at 11am. Admission to Woodhorn is free, and all-day parking costs £3.50. Video loading Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video July 22 - Sunderland Airshow 
The Sunderland Airshow is one of the largest seafront airshows in the UK, and the only major airshow in the North East. 
This year, the event launches in the traditional way at Cliffe Park on Friday, July 22, with the grand finale on Sunday 24. The weekender offers breathtaking aerial acrobatics, vintage aircrafts and - back on solid ground - exciting activities and entertainment for the whole family. 
Not to be missed, Sunderland’s airshow promises to thrill - and it’s free. 
Ladies Day at Newcastle Racecourse July 23 - Ladies Day at Newcastle Racecourse 
Proclaimed one of the biggest social events in the North East calendar, in which action and glamour combine, roll up for the Collingwood Insurance Beeswing Ladies Day at Newcastle Racecourse on Saturday, July 23. 
The glamorous event, named after Beeswing, the 19th century British thoroughbred racehorse from the North of England, opens its gates at 11am, with the first race kicking off at 2.10pm. 
Dine in the luxury restaurant or pavilion, and get your glad rags on, as there will be a best dressed competition with unbelievable prizes for the winner and runners up. Tickets start at £30 for the day. 
Newcastle will hope to get their Championship campaign off to a strong start in early August August 6 - First day of the Championship season 
It’s the moment you’re all waiting for - the Championship season begins on the weekend commencing Saturday, August 6. Newcastle will play at least 46 games during the regular season; 23 at St James’ Park , and the same number away. May 6, 2017 marks the final weekend of the regular season of the second tier of English football. 
The Tall Ships are coming to Blyth August 26 - Tall Ships at Blyth 
The Tall Ships will sail into Northumberland from Friday, August 26 to Monday 29. As many as 30 of the most imposing and spectacular vessels in the world will bring the Port of Blyth to life during the spellbinding four-­day festival, made all the more magical by nightly fireworks, live music and grand parades. 
This year’s celebration marks the 60th anniversary of the Tall Ships Races, and to commemorate the date the regatta will end with a race from Northumberland to Gothenburg, Sweden. 
Entry into the North Sea Tall Ships Regatta is free, as is a lot of the entertainment, with charges for some activities and attractions. 
Families at the Bellingham Show August 27 - Bellingham Show & Country Festival 
If you’re stuck on how to spend your bank holiday weekend this year, look no further than the Bellingham Show & Country Festival in the heart of the Northumberland countryside. An ideal day out for the whole family, the Bellingham Show boasts live bands, archery, wrestling, terrier racing, Northumbrian piping, good food and drink, and much, much more. 
The festival opens at 8.30am for exhibitors and 9am to the public. Buy your tickets on arrival; adults £7, children (3-16) £3 and babies go free. There is also free parking. Video loading Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video September 11 - Great North Run 
The Great North Run returns this year on Sunday September 11. In its most ambitious plan to date, the event is seeking to recruit one runner from each of the 193 countries in the United Nations to take part in the iconic half marathon. 
Great North Run founder Brendan Foster launched the event in 1981, when 12,000 participants ran from Newcastle to South Shields , calls the Great North Run ‘the world’s favourite run, because we’ve had more runners than anywhere else in the world.’ 
The Red Arrows are set to make an appearance, and entertainment is provided by many bands along the 13.1-mile route, starting in Newcastle. 
Although you can no longer enter the ballot to take part as a runner, the day is sure to provide much entertainment for spectators.
